SENT.plain: A 22-year-old white native Californian acquired multiple cranial nerve palsies
He was found to have a Burkitt's-type lymphoma involving the ethmoid and sphenoid sinuses, with orbital invasion
Despite aggressive therapy, he died 18 weeks after the onset of his illness
Poor prognostic indicators included CNS symptoms at the time of initial onset, bone marrow involvement, and postadolescent occurrence
The absence of viable tumor at autopsy indicates sensitivity of Burkitt's lymphoma cells to combination chemotherapy and irradiation treatment
